summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: These are the words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests from the town of Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord first gave messages to Jeremiah during the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s messages continued throughout the reign of King Jehoiakim, Josiah’s son, until the eleventh year of the reign of King Zedekiah, another of Josiah’s sons. In August of that eleventh year the people of Jerusalem were taken away as captives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave me this message:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I knew you before I formed you in your mother’s womb.
    Before you were born I set you apart
    and appointed you as my prophet to the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Sovereign Lord,” I said, “I can’t speak for you! I’m too young!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord replied, “Don’t say, ‘I’m too young,’ for you must go wherever I send you and say whatever I tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And don’t be afraid of the people, for I will be with you and will protect you. I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord reached out and touched my mouth and said,
“Look, I have put my words in your mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Today I appoint you to stand up
    against nations and kingdoms.
Some you must uproot and tear down,
    destroy and overthrow.
Others you must build up
    and plant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to me, “Look, Jeremiah! What do you see?”
And I replied, “I see a branch from an almond tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “That’s right, and it means that I am watching, and I will certainly carry out all my plans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord spoke to me again and asked, “What do you see now?”
And I replied, “I see a pot of boiling water, spilling from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes,” the Lord said, “for terror from the north will boil out on the people of this land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! I am calling the armies of the kingdoms of the north to come to Jerusalem. I, the Lord, have spoken!
“They will set their thrones
    at the gates of the city.
They will attack its walls
    and all the other towns of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pronounce judgment
    on my people for all their evil—
for deserting me and burning incense to other gods.
    Yes, they worship idols made with their own hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Get up and prepare for action.
    Go out and tell them everything I tell you to say.
Do not be afraid of them,
    or I will make you look foolish in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For see, today I have made you strong
    like a fortified city that cannot be captured,
    like an iron pillar or a bronze wall.
You will stand against the whole land—
    the kings, officials, priests, and people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will fight you, but they will fail.
    For I am with you, and I will take care of you.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave me another message. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go and shout this message to Jerusalem. This is what the Lord says: 
“I remember how eager you were to please me
    as a young bride long ago,
how you loved me and followed me
    even through the barren wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days Israel was holy to the Lord,
    the first of his children.
All who harmed his people were declared guilty,
    and disaster fell on them.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to the word of the Lord, people of Jacob—all you families of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“What did your ancestors find wrong with me
    that led them to stray so far from me?
They worshiped worthless idols,
    only to become worthless themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not ask, ‘Where is the Lord
    who brought us safely out of Egypt
and led us through the barren wilderness—
    a land of deserts and pits,
a land of drought and death,
    where no one lives or even travels?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And when I brought you into a fruitful land
    to enjoy its bounty and goodness,
you defiled my land and
    corrupted the possession I had promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The priests did not ask,
    ‘Where is the Lord?’
Those who taught my word ignored me,
    the rulers turned against me,
and the prophets spoke in the name of Baal,
    wasting their time on worthless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, I will bring my case against you,”
    says the Lord.
“I will even bring charges against your children’s children
    in the years to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go west and look in the land of Cyprus;
    go east and search through the land of Kedar.
Has anyone ever heard of anything
    as strange as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has any nation ever traded its gods for new ones,
    even though they are not gods at all?
Yet my people have exchanged their glorious God
    for worthless idols!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are shocked at such a thing
    and shrink back in horror and dismay,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For my people have done two evil things:
They have abandoned me—
    the fountain of living water.
And they have dug for themselves cracked cisterns
    that can hold no water at all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why has Israel become a slave?
    Why has he been carried away as plunder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strong lions have roared against him,
    and the land has been destroyed.
The towns are now in ruins,
    and no one lives in them anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egyptians, marching from their cities of Memphis and Tahpanhes,
    have destroyed Israel’s glory and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you have brought this upon yourselves
    by rebelling against the Lord your God,
    even though he was leading you on the way!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What have you gained by your alliances with Egypt
    and your covenants with Assyria?
What good to you are the streams of the Nile
    or the waters of the Euphrates River?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wickedness will bring its own punishment.
    Your turning from me will shame you.
You will see what an evil, bitter thing it is
    to abandon the Lord your God and not to fear him.
    I, the Lord, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Long ago I broke the yoke that oppressed you
    and tore away the chains of your slavery,
but still you said,
    ‘I will not serve you.’
On every hill and under every green tree,
    you have prostituted yourselves by bowing down to idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I was the one who planted you,
    choosing a vine of the purest stock—the very best.
    How did you grow into this corrupt wild vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No amount of soap or lye can make you clean.
    I still see the stain of your guilt.
    I, the Sovereign Lord, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You say, ‘That’s not true!
    I haven’t worshiped the images of Baal!’
But how can you say that?
    Go and look in any valley in the land!
Face the awful sins you have done.
    You are like a restless female camel
    desperately searching for a mate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are like a wild donkey,
    sniffing the wind at mating time.
Who can restrain her lust?
    Those who desire her don’t need to search,
    for she goes running to them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When will you stop running?
    When will you stop panting after other gods?
But you say, ‘Save your breath.
    I’m in love with these foreign gods,
    and I can’t stop loving them now!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Israel is like a thief
    who feels shame only when he gets caught.
They, their kings, officials, priests, and prophets—
    all are alike in this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To an image carved from a piece of wood they say,
    ‘You are my father.’
To an idol chiseled from a block of stone they say,
    ‘You are my mother.’
They turn their backs on me,
    but in times of trouble they cry out to me,
    ‘Come and save us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But why not call on these gods you have made?
    When trouble comes, let them save you if they can!
For you have as many gods
    as there are towns in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you accuse me of doing wrong?
    You are the ones who have rebelled,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have punished your children,
    but they did not respond to my discipline.
You yourselves have killed your prophets
    as a lion kills its prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O my people, listen to the words of the Lord!
    Have I been like a desert to Israel?
    Have I been to them a land of darkness?
Why then do my people say, ‘At last we are free from God!
    We don’t need him anymore!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does a young woman forget her jewelry,
    or a bride her wedding dress?
Yet for years on end
    my people have forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How you plot and scheme to win your lovers.
    Even an experienced prostitute could learn from you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your clothing is stained with the blood of the innocent and the poor,
    though you didn’t catch them breaking into your houses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And yet you say,
‘I have done nothing wrong.
    Surely God isn’t angry with me!’
But now I will punish you severely
    because you claim you have not sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
First here, then there—
    you flit from one ally to another asking for help.
But your new friends in Egypt will let you down,
    just as Assyria did before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In despair, you will be led into exile
    with your hands on your heads,
for the Lord has rejected the nations you trust.
    They will not help you at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If a man divorces a woman
    and she goes and marries someone else,
he will not take her back again,
    for that would surely corrupt the land.
But you have prostituted yourself with many lovers,
    so why are you trying to come back to me?”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look at the shrines on every hilltop.
    Is there any place you have not been defiled
    by your adultery with other gods?
You sit like a prostitute beside the road waiting for a customer.
    You sit alone like a nomad in the desert.
You have polluted the land with your prostitution
    and your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That’s why even the spring rains have failed.
    For you are a brazen prostitute and completely shameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you say to me,
    ‘Father, you have been my guide since my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you won’t be angry forever!
    Surely you can forget about it!’
So you talk,
    but you keep on doing all the evil you can.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the reign of King Josiah, the Lord said to me, “Have you seen what fickle Israel has done? Like a wife who commits adultery, Israel has worshiped other gods on every hill and under every green tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thought, ‘After she has done all this, she will return to me.’ But she did not return, and her faithless sister Judah saw this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw that I divorced faithless Israel because of her adultery. But that treacherous sister Judah had no fear, and now she, too, has left me and given herself to prostitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel treated it all so lightly—she thought nothing of committing adultery by worshiping idols made of wood and stone. So now the land has been polluted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But despite all this, her faithless sister Judah has never sincerely returned to me. She has only pretended to be sorry. I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Even faithless Israel is less guilty than treacherous Judah!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, go and give this message to Israel. This is what the Lord says:
“O Israel, my faithless people,
    come home to me again,
for I am merciful.
    I will not be angry with you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only acknowledge your guilt.
    Admit that you rebelled against the Lord your God
and committed adultery against him
    by worshiping idols under every green tree.
Confess that you refused to listen to my voice.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Return home, you wayward children,”
    says the Lord,
    “for I am your master.
I will bring you back to the land of Israel—
    one from this town and two from that family—
    from wherever you are scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will give you shepherds after my own heart,
    who will guide you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when your land is once more filled with people,” says the Lord, “you will no longer wish for ‘the good old days’ when you possessed the Ark of the Lord’s Covenant. You will not miss those days or even remember them, and there will be no need to rebuild the Ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day Jerusalem will be known as ‘The Throne of the Lord.’ All nations will come there to honor the Lord. They will no longer stubbornly follow their own evil desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the people of Judah and Israel will return together from exile in the north. They will return to the land I gave your ancestors as an inheritance forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I thought to myself,
    ‘I would love to treat you as my own children!’
I wanted nothing more than to give you this beautiful land—
    the finest possession in the world.
I looked forward to your calling me ‘Father,’
    and I wanted you never to turn from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have been unfaithful to me, you people of Israel!
    You have been like a faithless wife who leaves her husband.
    I, the Lord, have spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Voices are heard high on the windswept mountains,
    the weeping and pleading of Israel’s people.
For they have chosen crooked paths
    and have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My wayward children,” says the Lord,
    “come back to me, and I will heal your wayward hearts.”
“Yes, we’re coming,” the people reply,
    “for you are the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our worship of idols on the hills
    and our religious orgies on the mountains
    are a delusion.
Only in the Lord our God
    will Israel ever find salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From childhood we have watched
    as everything our ancestors worked for—
their flocks and herds, their sons and daughters—
    was squandered on a delusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us now lie down in shame
    and cover ourselves with dishonor,
for we and our ancestors have sinned
    against the Lord our God.
From our childhood to this day
    we have never obeyed him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O Israel,” says the Lord,
    “if you wanted to return to me, you could.
You could throw away your detestable idols
    and stray away no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then when you swear by my name, saying,
    ‘As surely as the Lord lives,’
you could do so
    with truth, justice, and righteousness.
Then you would be a blessing to the nations of the world,
    and all people would come and praise my name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says to the people of Judah and Jerusalem:
“Plow up the hard ground of your hearts!
    Do not waste your good seed among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O people of Judah and Jerusalem,
    surrender your pride and power.
Change your hearts before the Lord,
    or my anger will burn like an unquenchable fire
    because of all your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shout to Judah, and broadcast to Jerusalem!
    Tell them to sound the alarm throughout the land:
‘Run for your lives!
    Flee to the fortified cities!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Raise a signal flag as a warning for Jerusalem:
    ‘Flee now! Do not delay!’
For I am bringing terrible destruction upon you
    from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lion stalks from its den,
    a destroyer of nations.
It has left its lair and is headed your way.
    It’s going to devastate your land!
Your towns will lie in ruins,
    with no one living in them anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So put on clothes of mourning
    and weep with broken hearts,
for the fierce anger of the Lord
    is still upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In that day,” says the Lord,
    “the king and the officials will tremble in fear.
The priests will be struck with horror,
    and the prophets will be appalled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “O Sovereign Lord,
    the people have been deceived by what you said,
for you promised peace for Jerusalem.
    But the sword is held at their throats!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The time is coming when the Lord will say
    to the people of Jerusalem,
“My dear people, a burning wind is blowing in from the desert,
    and it’s not a gentle breeze useful for winnowing grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a roaring blast sent by me!
    Now I will pronounce your destruction!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our enemy rushes down on us like storm clouds!
    His chariots are like whirlwinds.
His horses are swifter than eagles.
    How terrible it will be, for we are doomed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jerusalem, cleanse your heart
    that you may be saved.
How long will you harbor
    your evil thoughts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your destruction has been announced
    from Dan and the hill country of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Warn the surrounding nations
    and announce this to Jerusalem:
The enemy is coming from a distant land,
    raising a battle cry against the towns of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surround Jerusalem like watchmen around a field,
    for my people have rebelled against me,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your own actions have brought this upon you.
    This punishment is bitter, piercing you to the heart!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart, my heart—I writhe in pain!
    My heart pounds within me! I cannot be still.
For I have heard the blast of enemy trumpets
    and the roar of their battle cries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Waves of destruction roll over the land,
    until it lies in complete desolation.
Suddenly my tents are destroyed;
    in a moment my shelters are crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must I see the battle flags
    and hear the trumpets of war?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My people are foolish
    and do not know me,” says the Lord.
“They are stupid children
    who have no understanding.
They are clever enough at doing wrong,
    but they have no idea how to do right!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the earth, and it was empty and formless.
    I looked at the heavens, and there was no light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the mountains and hills,
    and they trembled and shook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and all the people were gone.
    All the birds of the sky had flown away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and the fertile fields had become a wilderness.
    The towns lay in ruins,
    crushed by the Lord’s fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“The whole land will be ruined,
    but I will not destroy it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth will mourn
    and the heavens will be draped in black
because of my decree against my people.
    I have made up my mind and will not change it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the noise of charioteers and archers,
    the people flee in terror.
They hide in the bushes
    and run for the mountains.
All the towns have been abandoned—
    not a person remains!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What are you doing,
    you who have been plundered?
Why do you dress up in beautiful clothing
    and put on gold jewelry?
Why do you brighten your eyes with mascara?
    Your primping will do you no good!
The allies who were your lovers
    despise you and seek to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hear a cry, like that of a woman in labor,
    the groans of a woman giving birth to her first child.
It is beautiful Jerusalem
    gasping for breath and crying out,
    “Help! I’m being murdered!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Run up and down every street in Jerusalem,” says the Lord.
    “Look high and low; search throughout the city!
If you can find even one just and honest person,
    I will not destroy the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But even when they are under oath,
    saying, ‘As surely as the Lord lives,’
    they are still telling lies!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you are searching for honesty.
You struck your people,
    but they paid no attention.
You crushed them,
    but they refused to be corrected.
They are determined, with faces set like stone;
    they have refused to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “But what can we expect from the poor?
    They are ignorant.
They don’t know the ways of the Lord.
    They don’t understand God’s laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will go and speak to their leaders.
    Surely they know the ways of the Lord
    and understand God’s laws.”
But the leaders, too, as one man,
    had thrown off God’s yoke
    and broken his chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now a lion from the forest will attack them;
    a wolf from the desert will pounce on them.
A leopard will lurk near their towns,
    tearing apart any who dare to venture out.
For their rebellion is great,
    and their sins are many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can I pardon you?
    For even your children have turned from me.
They have sworn by gods that are not gods at all!
    I fed my people until they were full.
But they thanked me by committing adultery
    and lining up at the brothels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are well-fed, lusty stallions,
    each neighing for his neighbor’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this?” says the Lord.
    “Should I not avenge myself against such a nation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go down the rows of the vineyards and destroy the grapevines,
    leaving a scattered few alive.
Strip the branches from the vines,
    for these people do not belong to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people of Israel and Judah
    are full of treachery against me,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They have lied about the Lord
    and said, ‘He won’t bother us!
No disasters will come upon us.
    There will be no war or famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God’s prophets are all windbags
    who don’t really speak for him.
    Let their predictions of disaster fall on themselves!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord God of Heaven’s Armies says:
“Because the people are talking like this,
    my messages will flame out of your mouth
    and burn the people like kindling wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, I will bring a distant nation against you,”
    says the Lord.
“It is a mighty nation,
    an ancient nation,
a people whose language you do not know,
    whose speech you cannot understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their weapons are deadly;
    their warriors are mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “Yet even in those days I will not blot you out completely,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when your people ask, ‘Why did the Lord our God do all this to us?’ you must reply, ‘You rejected him and gave yourselves to foreign gods in your own land. Now you will serve foreigners in a land that is not your own.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Make this announcement to Israel,
    and say this to Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, you foolish and senseless people,
    with eyes that do not see
    and ears that do not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you no respect for me?
    Why don’t you tremble in my presence?
I, the Lord, define the ocean’s sandy shoreline
    as an everlasting boundary that the waters cannot cross.
The waves may toss and roar,
    but they can never pass the boundaries I set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my people have stubborn and rebellious hearts.
    They have turned away and abandoned me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not say from the heart,
    ‘Let us live in awe of the Lord our God,
for he gives us rain each spring and fall,
    assuring us of a harvest when the time is right.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wickedness has deprived you of these wonderful blessings.
    Your sin has robbed you of all these good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Among my people are wicked men
    who lie in wait for victims like a hunter hiding in a blind.
They continually set traps
    to catch people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a cage filled with birds,
    their homes are filled with evil plots.
    And now they are great and rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are fat and sleek,
    and there is no limit to their wicked deeds.
They refuse to provide justice to orphans
    and deny the rights of the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this?” says the Lord.
    “Should I not avenge myself against such a nation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A horrible and shocking thing
    has happened in this land—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the prophets give false prophecies,
    and the priests rule with an iron hand.
Worse yet, my people like it that way!
    But what will you do when the end comes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Run for your lives, you people of Benjamin!
    Get out of Jerusalem!
Sound the alarm in Tekoa!
    Send up a signal at Beth-hakkerem!
A powerful army is coming from the north,
    coming with disaster and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jerusalem, you are my beautiful and delicate daughter—
    but I will destroy you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Enemies will surround you, like shepherds camped around the city.
    Each chooses a place for his troops to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shout, ‘Prepare for battle!
    Attack at noon!’
‘No, it’s too late; the day is fading,
    and the evening shadows are falling.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Well then, let’s attack at night
    and destroy her palaces!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies says:
“Cut down the trees for battering rams.
    Build siege ramps against the walls of Jerusalem.
This is the city to be punished,
    for she is wicked through and through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She spouts evil like a fountain.
    Her streets echo with the sounds of violence and destruction.
    I always see her sickness and sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to this warning, Jerusalem,
    or I will turn from you in disgust.
Listen, or I will turn you into a heap of ruins,
    a land where no one lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies says:
“Even the few who remain in Israel
    will be picked over again,
as when a harvester checks each vine a second time
    to pick the grapes that were missed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom can I give warning?
    Who will listen when I speak?
Their ears are closed,
    and they cannot hear.
They scorn the word of the Lord.
    They don’t want to listen at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now I am filled with the Lord’s fury.
    Yes, I am tired of holding it in!
“I will pour out my fury on children playing in the streets
    and on gatherings of young men,
on husbands and wives
    and on those who are old and gray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their homes will be turned over to their enemies,
    as will their fields and their wives.
For I will raise my powerful fist
    against the people of this land,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“From the least to the greatest,
    their lives are ruled by greed.
From prophets to priests,
    they are all frauds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They offer superficial treatments
    for my people’s mortal wound.
They give assurances of peace
    when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are they ashamed of their disgusting actions?
    Not at all—they don’t even know how to blush!
Therefore, they will lie among the slaughtered.
    They will be brought down when I punish them,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Stop at the crossroads and look around.
    Ask for the old, godly way, and walk in it.
Travel its path, and you will find rest for your souls.
    But you reply, ‘No, that’s not the road we want!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I posted watchmen over you who said,
    ‘Listen for the sound of the alarm.’
But you replied,
    ‘No! We won’t pay attention!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, listen to this, all you nations.
    Take note of my people’s situation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, all the earth!
    I will bring disaster on my people.
It is the fruit of their own schemes,
    because they refuse to listen to me.
    They have rejected my word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There’s no use offering me sweet frankincense from Sheba.
    Keep your fragrant calamus imported from distant lands!
I will not accept your burnt offerings.
    Your sacrifices have no pleasing aroma for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord says:
    “I will put obstacles in my people’s path.
Fathers and sons will both fall over them.
    Neighbors and friends will die together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Look! A great army coming from the north!
    A great nation is rising against you from far-off lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are armed with bows and spears.
    They are cruel and show no mercy.
They sound like a roaring sea
    as they ride forward on horses.
They are coming in battle formation,
    planning to destroy you, beautiful Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard reports about the enemy,
    and we wring our hands in fright.
Pangs of anguish have gripped us,
    like those of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t go out to the fields!
    Don’t travel on the roads!
The enemy’s sword is everywhere
    and terrorizes us at every turn!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, my people, dress yourselves in burlap
    and sit among the ashes.
Mourn and weep bitterly, as for the loss of an only son.
    For suddenly the destroying armies will be upon you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Jeremiah, I have made you a tester of metals,
    that you may determine the quality of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are the worst kind of rebel,
    full of slander.
They are as hard as bronze and iron,
    and they lead others into corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bellows fiercely fan the flames
    to burn out the corruption.
But it does not purify them,
    for the wickedness remains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will label them ‘Rejected Silver,’
    for I, the Lord, am discarding them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave another message to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to the entrance of the Lord’s Temple, and give this message to the people: ‘O Judah, listen to this message from the Lord! Listen to it, all of you who worship here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, says:
“‘Even now, if you quit your evil ways, I will let you stay in your own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But don’t be fooled by those who promise you safety simply because the Lord’s Temple is here. They chant, “The Lord’s Temple is here! The Lord’s Temple is here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will be merciful only if you stop your evil thoughts and deeds and start treating each other with justice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only if you stop exploiting foreigners, orphans, and widows; only if you stop your murdering; and only if you stop harming yourselves by worshiping idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will let you stay in this land that I gave to your ancestors to keep forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Don’t be fooled into thinking that you will never suffer because the Temple is here. It’s a lie!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you really think you can steal, murder, commit adultery, lie, and burn incense to Baal and all those other new gods of yours,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then come here and stand before me in my Temple and chant, “We are safe!”—only to go right back to all those evils again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you yourselves admit that this Temple, which bears my name, has become a den of thieves? Surely I see all the evil going on there. I, the Lord, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Go now to the place at Shiloh where I once put the Tabernacle that bore my name. See what I did there because of all the wickedness of my people, the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you were doing these wicked things, says the Lord, I spoke to you about it repeatedly, but you would not listen. I called out to you, but you refused to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So just as I destroyed Shiloh, I will now destroy this Temple that bears my name, this Temple that you trust in for help, this place that I gave to you and your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send you out of my sight into exile, just as I did your relatives, the people of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pray no more for these people, Jeremiah. Do not weep or pray for them, and don’t beg me to help them, for I will not listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you see what they are doing throughout the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No wonder I am so angry! Watch how the children gather wood and the fathers build sacrificial fires. See how the women knead dough and make cakes to offer to the Queen of Heaven. And they pour out liquid offerings to their other idol gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I the one they are hurting?” asks the Lord. “Most of all, they hurt themselves, to their own shame.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this is what the Sovereign Lord says: “I will pour out my terrible fury on this place. Its people, animals, trees, and crops will be consumed by the unquenchable fire of my anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Take your burnt offerings and your other sacrifices and eat them yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I led your ancestors out of Egypt, it was not burnt offerings and sacrifices I wanted from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I told them: ‘Obey me, and I will be your God, and you will be my people. Do everything as I say, and all will be well!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But my people would not listen to me. They kept doing whatever they wanted, following the stubborn desires of their evil hearts. They went backward instead of forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the day your ancestors left Egypt until now, I have continued to send my servants, the prophets—day in and day out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my people have not listened to me or even tried to hear. They have been stubborn and sinful—even worse than their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell them all this, but do not expect them to listen. Shout out your warnings, but do not expect them to respond.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘This is the nation whose people will not obey the Lord their God and who refuse to be taught. Truth has vanished from among them; it is no longer heard on their lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shave your head in mourning, and weep alone on the mountains. For the Lord has rejected and forsaken this generation that has provoked his fury.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people of Judah have sinned before my very eyes,” says the Lord. “They have set up their abominable idols right in the Temple that bears my name, defiling it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built pagan shrines at Topheth, the garbage dump in the valley of Ben-Hinnom, and there they burn their sons and daughters in the fire. I have never commanded such a horrible deed; it never even crossed my mind to command such a thing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So beware, for the time is coming,” says the Lord, “when that garbage dump will no longer be called Topheth or the valley of Ben-Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter. They will bury the bodies in Topheth until there is no more room for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bodies of my people will be food for the vultures and wild animals, and no one will be left to scare them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put an end to the happy singing and laughter in the streets of Jerusalem. The joyful voices of bridegrooms and brides will no longer be heard in the towns of Judah. The land will lie in complete desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In that day,” says the Lord, “the enemy will break open the graves of the kings and officials of Judah, and the graves of the priests, prophets, and common people of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will spread out their bones on the ground before the sun, moon, and stars—the gods my people have loved, served, and worshiped. Their bones will not be gathered up again or buried but will be scattered on the ground like manure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of this evil nation who survive will wish to die rather than live where I will send them. I, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Jeremiah, say to the people, ‘This is what the Lord says:
“‘When people fall down, don’t they get up again?
    When they discover they’re on the wrong road, don’t they turn back?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then why do these people stay on their self-destructive path?
    Why do the people of Jerusalem refuse to turn back?
They cling tightly to their lies
    and will not turn around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I listen to their conversations
    and don’t hear a word of truth.
Is anyone sorry for doing wrong?
    Does anyone say, “What a terrible thing I have done”?
No! All are running down the path of sin
    as swiftly as a horse galloping into battle!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the stork that flies across the sky
    knows the time of her migration,
as do the turtledove, the swallow, and the crane.
    They all return at the proper time each year.
But not my people!
    They do not know the Lord’s laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘How can you say, “We are wise because we have the word of the Lord,”
    when your teachers have twisted it by writing lies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These wise teachers will fall
    into the trap of their own foolishness,
for they have rejected the word of the Lord.
    Are they so wise after all?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give their wives to others
    and their farms to strangers.
From the least to the greatest,
    their lives are ruled by greed.
Yes, even my prophets and priests are like that.
    They are all frauds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They offer superficial treatments
    for my people’s mortal wound.
They give assurances of peace
    when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are they ashamed of these disgusting actions?
    Not at all—they don’t even know how to blush!
Therefore, they will lie among the slaughtered.
    They will be brought down when I punish them,
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will surely consume them.
    There will be no more harvests of figs and grapes.
Their fruit trees will all die.
    Whatever I gave them will soon be gone.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then the people will say,
    ‘Why should we wait here to die?
Come, let’s go to the fortified towns and die there.
    For the Lord our God has decreed our destruction
and has given us a cup of poison to drink
    because we sinned against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We hoped for peace, but no peace came.
    We hoped for a time of healing, but found only terror.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The snorting of the enemies’ warhorses can be heard
    all the way from the land of Dan in the north!
The neighing of their stallions makes the whole land tremble.
    They are coming to devour the land and everything in it—
    cities and people alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will send these enemy troops among you
    like poisonous snakes you cannot charm.
They will bite you, and you will die.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My grief is beyond healing;
    my heart is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the weeping of my people;
    it can be heard all across the land.
“Has the Lord abandoned Jerusalem?” the people ask.
    “Is her King no longer there?”
“Oh, why have they provoked my anger with their carved idols
    and their worthless foreign gods?” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The harvest is finished,
    and the summer is gone,” the people cry,
    “yet we are not saved!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hurt with the hurt of my people.
    I mourn and am overcome with grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no medicine in Gilead?
    Is there no physician there?
Why is there no healing
    for the wounds of my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only my head were a pool of water
    and my eyes a fountain of tears,
I would weep day and night
    for all my people who have been slaughtered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that I could go away and forget my people
    and live in a travelers’ shack in the desert.
For they are all adulterers—
    a pack of treacherous liars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My people bend their tongues like bows
    to shoot out lies.
They refuse to stand up for the truth.
    They only go from bad to worse.
They do not know me,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Beware of your neighbor!
    Don’t even trust your brother!
For brother takes advantage of brother,
    and friend slanders friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They pile lie upon lie
    and utterly refuse to acknowledge me,”
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies says:
“See, I will melt them down in a crucible
    and test them like metal.
What else can I do with my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their tongues shoot lies like poisoned arrows.
They speak friendly words to their neighbors
    while scheming in their heart to kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this?” says the Lord.
    “Should I not avenge myself against such a nation?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I will make Jerusalem into a heap of ruins,” says the Lord.
    “It will be a place haunted by jackals.
The towns of Judah will be ghost towns,
    with no one living in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is wise enough to understand all this? Who has been instructed by the Lord and can explain it to others? Why has the land been so ruined that no one dares to travel through it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord replies, “This has happened because my people have abandoned my instructions; they have refused to obey what I said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, they have stubbornly followed their own desires and worshiped the images of Baal, as their ancestors taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, this is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, says: Look! I will feed them with bitterness and give them poison to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter them around the world, in places they and their ancestors never heard of, and even there I will chase them with the sword until I have destroyed them completely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies says:
“Consider all this, and call for the mourners.
    Send for the women who mourn at funerals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Quick! Begin your weeping!
    Let the tears flow from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the people of Jerusalem crying in despair,
    ‘We are ruined! We are completely humiliated!
We must leave our land,
    because our homes have been torn down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For death has crept in through our windows
    and has entered our mansions.
It has killed off the flower of our youth:
    Children no longer play in the streets,
    and young men no longer gather in the squares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Bodies will be scattered across the fields like clumps of manure,
    like bundles of grain after the harvest.
    No one will be left to bury them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Don’t let the wise boast in their wisdom,
    or the powerful boast in their power,
    or the rich boast in their riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who wish to boast
    should boast in this alone:
that they truly know me and understand that I am the Lord
    who demonstrates unfailing love
    and who brings justice and righteousness to the earth,
and that I delight in these things.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A time is coming,” says the Lord, “when I will punish all those who are circumcised in body but not in spirit—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Egyptians, Edomites, Ammonites, Moabites, the people who live in the desert in remote places, and yes, even the people of Judah. And like all these pagan nations, the people of Israel also have uncircumcised hearts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word that the Lord speaks to you, O Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Do not act like the other nations,
    who try to read their future in the stars.
Do not be afraid of their predictions,
    even though other nations are terrified by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their ways are futile and foolish.
    They cut down a tree, and a craftsman carves an idol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They decorate it with gold and silver
    and then fasten it securely with hammer and nails
    so it won’t fall over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their gods are like
    helpless scarecrows in a cucumber field!
They cannot speak,
    and they need to be carried because they cannot walk.
Do not be afraid of such gods,
    for they can neither harm you nor do you any good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, there is no one like you!
    For you are great, and your name is full of power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who would not fear you, O King of nations?
    That title belongs to you alone!
Among all the wise people of the earth
    and in all the kingdoms of the world,
    there is no one like you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People who worship idols are stupid and foolish.
    The things they worship are made of wood!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They bring beaten sheets of silver from Tarshish
    and gold from Uphaz,
and they give these materials to skillful craftsmen
    who make their idols.
Then they dress these gods in royal blue and purple robes
    made by expert tailors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is the only true God.
    He is the living God and the everlasting King!
The whole earth trembles at his anger.
    The nations cannot stand up to his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say this to those who worship other gods: “Your so-called gods, who did not make the heavens and earth, will vanish from the earth and from under the heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord made the earth by his power,
    and he preserves it by his wisdom.
With his own understanding
    he stretched out the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he speaks in the thunder,
    the heavens roar with rain.
He causes the clouds to rise over the earth.
    He sends the lightning with the rain
    and releases the wind from his storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whole human race is foolish and has no knowledge!
    The craftsmen are disgraced by the idols they make,
for their carefully shaped works are a fraud.
    These idols have no breath or power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Idols are worthless; they are ridiculous lies!
    On the day of reckoning they will all be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the God of Israel is no idol!
    He is the Creator of everything that exists,
including Israel, his own special possession.
    The Lord of Heaven’s Armies is his name!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pack your bags and prepare to leave;
    the siege is about to begin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says:
“Suddenly, I will fling out
    all you who live in this land.
I will pour great troubles upon you,
    and at last you will feel my anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My wound is severe,
    and my grief is great.
My sickness is incurable,
    but I must bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My home is gone,
    and no one is left to help me rebuild it.
My children have been taken away,
    and I will never see them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds of my people have lost their senses.
    They no longer seek wisdom from the Lord.
Therefore, they fail completely,
    and their flocks are scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! Hear the terrifying roar of great armies
    as they roll down from the north.
The towns of Judah will be destroyed
    and become a haunt for jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, Lord, that our lives are not our own.
    We are not able to plan our own course.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So correct me, Lord, but please be gentle.
    Do not correct me in anger, for I would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations that refuse to acknowledge you—
    on the peoples that do not call upon your name.
For they have devoured your people Israel;
    they have devoured and consumed them,
    making the land a desolate wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave another message to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remind the people of Judah and Jerusalem about the terms of my covenant with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Cursed is anyone who does not obey the terms of my covenant!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I said to your ancestors when I brought them out of the iron-smelting furnace of Egypt, “If you obey me and do whatever I command you, then you will be my people, and I will be your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said this so I could keep my promise to your ancestors to give you a land flowing with milk and honey—the land you live in today.’”
Then I replied, “Amen, Lord! May it be so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Broadcast this message in the streets of Jerusalem. Go from town to town throughout the land and say, ‘Remember the ancient covenant, and do everything it requires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I solemnly warned your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, “Obey me!” I have repeated this warning over and over to this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but your ancestors did not listen or even pay attention. Instead, they stubbornly followed their own evil desires. And because they refused to obey, I brought upon them all the curses described in this covenant.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to me and said, “I have discovered a conspiracy against me among the people of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have returned to the sins of their ancestors. They have refused to listen to me and are worshiping other gods. Israel and Judah have both broken the covenant I made with their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: I am going to bring calamity upon them, and they will not escape. Though they beg for mercy, I will not listen to their cries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Judah and Jerusalem will pray to their idols and burn incense before them. But the idols will not save them when disaster strikes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look now, people of Judah; you have as many gods as you have towns. You have as many altars of shame—altars for burning incense to your god Baal—as there are streets in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pray no more for these people, Jeremiah. Do not weep or pray for them, for I will not listen to them when they cry out to me in distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What right do my beloved people have to come to my Temple,
    when they have done so many immoral things?
Can their vows and sacrifices prevent their destruction?
    They actually rejoice in doing evil!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, the Lord, once called them a thriving olive tree,
    beautiful to see and full of good fruit.
But now I have sent the fury of their enemies
    to burn them with fire,
    leaving them charred and broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, who planted this olive tree, have ordered it destroyed. For the people of Israel and Judah have done evil, arousing my anger by burning incense to Baal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me about the plots my enemies were making against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was like a lamb being led to the slaughter. I had no idea that they were planning to kill me! “Let’s destroy this man and all his words,” they said. “Let’s cut him down, so his name will be forgotten forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord of Heaven’s Armies,
you make righteous judgments,
    and you examine the deepest thoughts and secrets.
Let me see your vengeance against them,
    for I have committed my cause to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says about the men of Anathoth who wanted me dead. They had said, “We will kill you if you do not stop prophesying in the Lord’s name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies says about them: “I will punish them! Their young men will die in battle, and their boys and girls will starve to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not one of these plotters from Anathoth will survive, for I will bring disaster upon them when their time of punishment comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you always give me justice
    when I bring a case before you.
So let me bring you this complaint:
Why are the wicked so prosperous?
    Why are evil people so happy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have planted them,
    and they have taken root and prospered.
Your name is on their lips,
    but you are far from their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, Lord, you know my heart.
    You see me and test my thoughts.
Drag these people away like sheep to be butchered!
    Set them aside to be slaughtered!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must this land mourn?
    Even the grass in the fields has withered.
The wild animals and birds have disappeared
    because of the evil in the land.
For the people have said,
    “The Lord doesn’t see what’s ahead for us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If racing against mere men makes you tired,
    how will you race against horses?
If you stumble and fall on open ground,
    what will you do in the thickets near the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even your brothers, members of your own family,
    have turned against you.
    They plot and raise complaints against you.
Do not trust them,
    no matter how pleasantly they speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have abandoned my people, my special possession.
    I have surrendered my dearest ones to their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My chosen people have roared at me like a lion of the forest,
    so I have treated them with contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My chosen people act like speckled vultures,
    but they themselves are surrounded by vultures.
    Bring on the wild animals to pick their corpses clean!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Many rulers have ravaged my vineyard,
    trampling down the vines
    and turning all its beauty into a barren wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have made it an empty wasteland;
    I hear its mournful cry.
The whole land is desolate,
    and no one even cares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On all the bare hilltops,
    destroying armies can be seen.
The sword of the Lord devours people
    from one end of the nation to the other.
    No one will escape!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people have planted wheat
    but are harvesting thorns.
They have worn themselves out,
    but it has done them no good.
They will harvest a crop of shame
    because of the fierce anger of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is what the Lord says: “I will uproot from their land all the evil nations reaching out for the possession I gave my people Israel. And I will uproot Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward I will return and have compassion on all of them. I will bring them home to their own lands again, each nation to its own possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if these nations truly learn the ways of my people, and if they learn to swear by my name, saying, ‘As surely as the Lord lives’ (just as they taught my people to swear by the name of Baal), then they will be given a place among my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But any nation who refuses to obey me will be uprooted and destroyed. I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord said to me: “Go and buy a linen loincloth and put it on, but do not wash it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought the loincloth as the Lord directed me, and I put it on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord gave me another message:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the linen loincloth you are wearing, and go to the Euphrates River. Hide it there in a hole in the rocks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates as the Lord had instructed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A long time afterward the Lord said to me, “Go back to the Euphrates and get the loincloth I told you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went to the Euphrates and dug it out of the hole where I had hidden it. But now it was rotting and falling apart. The loincloth was good for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I received this message from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord says: This shows how I will rot away the pride of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These wicked people refuse to listen to me. They stubbornly follow their own desires and worship other gods. Therefore, they will become like this loincloth—good for nothing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a loincloth clings to a man’s waist, so I created Judah and Israel to cling to me, says the Lord. They were to be my people, my pride, my glory—an honor to my name. But they would not listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So tell them, ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: May all your jars be filled with wine.’ And they will reply, ‘Of course! Jars are made to be filled with wine!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then tell them, ‘No, this is what the Lord means: I will fill everyone in this land with drunkenness—from the king sitting on David’s throne to the priests and the prophets, right down to the common people of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will smash them against each other, even parents against children, says the Lord. I will not let my pity or mercy or compassion keep me from destroying them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen and pay attention!
    Do not be arrogant, for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give glory to the Lord your God
    before it is too late.
Acknowledge him before he brings darkness upon you,
    causing you to stumble and fall on the darkening mountains.
For then, when you look for light,
    you will find only terrible darkness and gloom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if you still refuse to listen,
    I will weep alone because of your pride.
My eyes will overflow with tears,
    because the Lord’s flock will be led away into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and his mother,
“Come down from your thrones
    and sit in the dust,
for your glorious crowns
    will soon be snatched from your heads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The towns of the Negev will close their gates,
    and no one will be able to open them.
The people of Judah will be taken away as captives.
    All will be carried into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open up your eyes and see
    the armies marching down from the north!
Where is your flock—
    your beautiful flock—
    that he gave you to care for?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you say when the Lord takes the allies you have cultivated
    and appoints them as your rulers?
Pangs of anguish will grip you,
    like those of a woman in labor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You may ask yourself,
“Why is all this happening to me?”
    It is because of your many sins!
That is why you have been stripped
    and raped by invading armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can an Ethiopian change the color of his skin?
    Can a leopard take away its spots?
Neither can you start doing good,
    for you have always done evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will scatter you like chaff
    that is blown away by the desert winds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is your allotment,
    the portion I have assigned to you,”
    says the Lord,
“for you have forgotten me,
    putting your trust in false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I myself will strip you
    and expose you to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen your adultery and lust,
    and your disgusting idol worship out in the fields and on the hills.
What sorrow awaits you, Jerusalem!
    How long before you are pure?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This message came to Jeremiah from the Lord, explaining why he was holding back the rain:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Judah wilts;
    commerce at the city gates grinds to a halt.
All the people sit on the ground in mourning,
    and a great cry rises from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nobles send servants to get water,
    but all the wells are dry.
The servants return with empty pitchers,
    confused and desperate,
    covering their heads in grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ground is parched
    and cracked for lack of rain.
The farmers are deeply troubled;
    they, too, cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the doe abandons her newborn fawn
    because there is no grass in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wild donkeys stand on the bare hills
    panting like thirsty jackals.
They strain their eyes looking for grass,
    but there is none to be found.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people say, “Our wickedness has caught up with us, Lord,
    but help us for the sake of your own reputation.
We have turned away from you
    and sinned against you again and again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Hope of Israel, our Savior in times of trouble,
    why are you like a stranger to us?
Why are you like a traveler passing through the land,
    stopping only for the night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are you also confused?
    Is our champion helpless to save us?
You are right here among us, Lord.
    We are known as your people.
    Please don’t abandon us now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So this is what the Lord says to his people:
“You love to wander far from me
    and do not restrain yourselves.
Therefore, I will no longer accept you as my people.
    Now I will remember all your wickedness
    and will punish you for your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Do not pray for these people anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they fast, I will pay no attention. When they present their burnt offerings and grain offerings to me, I will not accept them. Instead, I will devour them with war, famine, and disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “O Sovereign Lord, their prophets are telling them, ‘All is well—no war or famine will come. The Lord will surely send you peace.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “These prophets are telling lies in my name. I did not send them or tell them to speak. I did not give them any messages. They prophesy of visions and revelations they have never seen or heard. They speak foolishness made up in their own lying hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: I will punish these lying prophets, for they have spoken in my name even though I never sent them. They say that no war or famine will come, but they themselves will die by war and famine!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the people to whom they prophesy—their bodies will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem, victims of famine and war. There will be no one left to bury them. Husbands, wives, sons, and daughters—all will be gone. For I will pour out their own wickedness on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, Jeremiah, say this to them:
“Night and day my eyes overflow with tears.
    I cannot stop weeping,
for my virgin daughter—my precious people—
    has been struck down
    and lies mortally wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I go out into the fields,
    I see the bodies of people slaughtered by the enemy.
If I walk the city streets,
    I see people who have died of starvation.
The prophets and priests continue with their work,
    but they don’t know what they’re doing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, have you completely rejected Judah?
    Do you really hate Jerusalem?
Why have you wounded us past all hope of healing?
    We hoped for peace, but no peace came.
    We hoped for a time of healing, but found only terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, we confess our wickedness
    and that of our ancestors, too.
    We all have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of your reputation, Lord, do not abandon us.
    Do not disgrace your own glorious throne.
Please remember us,
    and do not break your covenant with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can any of the worthless foreign gods send us rain?
    Does it fall from the sky by itself?
No, you are the one, O Lord our God!
    Only you can do such things.
    So we will wait for you to help us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel stood before me pleading for these people, I wouldn’t help them. Away with them! Get them out of my sight!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “I will send four kinds of destroyers against them,” says the Lord. “I will send the sword to kill, the dogs to drag away, the vultures to devour, and the wild animals to finish up what is left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the wicked things Manasseh son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem, I will make my people an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who will feel sorry for you, Jerusalem?
    Who will weep for you?
    Who will even bother to ask how you are?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have abandoned me
    and turned your back on me,”
    says the Lord.
“Therefore, I will raise my fist to destroy you.
    I am tired of always giving you another chance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will winnow you like grain at the gates of your cities
    and take away the children you hold dear.
I will destroy my own people,
    because they refuse to change their evil ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be more widows
    than the grains of sand on the seashore.
At noontime I will bring a destroyer
    against the mothers of young men.
I will cause anguish and terror
    to come upon them suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mother of seven grows faint and gasps for breath;
    her sun has gone down while it is still day.
She sits childless now,
    disgraced and humiliated.
And I will hand over those who are left
    to be killed by the enemy.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said,
“What sorrow is mine, my mother.
    Oh, that I had died at birth!
    I am hated everywhere I go.
I am neither a lender who threatens to foreclose
    nor a borrower who refuses to pay—
    yet they all curse me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord replied,
“I will take care of you, Jeremiah.
    Your enemies will ask you to plead on their behalf
    in times of trouble and distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man break a bar of iron from the north,
    or a bar of bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At no cost to them,
    I will hand over your wealth and treasures
as plunder to your enemies,
    for sin runs rampant in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will tell your enemies to take you
    as captives to a foreign land.
For my anger blazes like a fire
    that will burn forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said,
“Lord, you know what’s happening to me.
    Please step in and help me. Punish my persecutors!
Please give me time; don’t let me die young.
    It’s for your sake that I am suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I discovered your words, I devoured them.
    They are my joy and my heart’s delight,
for I bear your name,
    O Lord God of Heaven’s Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I never joined the people in their merry feasts.
    I sat alone because your hand was on me.
    I was filled with indignation at their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why then does my suffering continue?
    Why is my wound so incurable?
Your help seems as uncertain as a seasonal brook,
    like a spring that has gone dry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is how the Lord responds:
“If you return to me, I will restore you
    so you can continue to serve me.
If you speak good words rather than worthless ones,
    you will be my spokesman.
You must influence them;
    do not let them influence you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will fight against you like an attacking army,
    but I will make you as secure as a fortified wall of bronze.
They will not conquer you,
    for I am with you to protect and rescue you.
    I, the Lord, have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I will certainly keep you safe from these wicked men.
    I will rescue you from their cruel hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave me another message. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not get married or have children in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says about the children born here in this city and about their mothers and fathers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will die from terrible diseases. No one will mourn for them or bury them, and they will lie scattered on the ground like manure. They will die from war and famine, and their bodies will be food for the vultures and wild animals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: “Do not go to funerals to mourn and show sympathy for these people, for I have removed my protection and peace from them. I have taken away my unfailing love and my mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both the great and the lowly will die in this land. No one will bury them or mourn for them. Their friends will not cut themselves in sorrow or shave their heads in sadness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will offer a meal to comfort those who mourn for the dead—not even at the death of a mother or father. No one will send a cup of wine to console them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And do not go to their feasts and parties. Do not eat and drink with them at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, says: In your own lifetime, before your very eyes, I will put an end to the happy singing and laughter in this land. The joyful voices of bridegrooms and brides will no longer be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you tell the people all these things, they will ask, ‘Why has the Lord decreed such terrible things against us? What have we done to deserve such treatment? What is our sin against the Lord our God?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you will give them the Lord’s reply: ‘It is because your ancestors were unfaithful to me. They worshiped other gods and served them. They abandoned me and did not obey my word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are even worse than your ancestors! You stubbornly follow your own evil desires and refuse to listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will throw you out of this land and send you into a foreign land where you and your ancestors have never been. There you can worship idols day and night—and I will grant you no favors!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the time is coming,” says the Lord, “when people who are taking an oath will no longer say, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who rescued the people of Israel from the land of Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, they will say, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the people of Israel back to their own land from the land of the north and from all the countries to which he had exiled them.’ For I will bring them back to this land that I gave their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now I am sending for many fishermen who will catch them,” says the Lord. “I am sending for hunters who will hunt them down in the mountains, hills, and caves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am watching them closely, and I see every sin. They cannot hope to hide from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will double their punishment for all their sins, because they have defiled my land with lifeless images of their detestable gods and have filled my territory with their evil deeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you are my strength and fortress,
    my refuge in the day of trouble!
Nations from around the world
    will come to you and say,
“Our ancestors left us a foolish heritage,
    for they worshiped worthless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can people make their own gods?
    These are not real gods at all!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says,
“Now I will show them my power;
    now I will show them my might.
At last they will know and understand
    that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The sin of Judah
    is inscribed with an iron chisel—
engraved with a diamond point on their stony hearts
    and on the corners of their altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even their children go to worship
    at their pagan altars and Asherah poles,
beneath every green tree
    and on every high hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will hand over my holy mountain—
    along with all your wealth and treasures
    and your pagan shrines—
as plunder to your enemies,
    for sin runs rampant in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wonderful possession I have reserved for you
    will slip from your hands.
